items.title: From bartering ice cream for meals to a $125M business: How Jeni’s founder launched her sweet treat empire
items.description: Jeni Britton, founder of Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams, turned a $40,000 loan into a $125 million business.

items.title: Why Goldman Sachs’ CIO is taking a measured approach to rolling out AI across the business
items.description: Half of the 46,000 employees at Goldman Sachs have access to AI, and CIO Marco Argenti expects more will tap into the technology this year.

items.title: Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel wants to use AI to make it “easier for everybody to experience the world”

items.title: Trump’s tariffs and policies are putting America’s economy at risk: Consumer Technology Association CEO
items.description: Higher tariffs are already creating “cost shocks” for businesses, which for many will be passed on to consumers.

items.title: The Boeing Starliner astronauts have returned to Earth after nine long months stuck in space—but their $150,000 salary won’t come with overtime
